item.title: Covid-19: Crucial for pinged people to self-isolate - No 10
item.description: Downing Street tries to clear up confusion after a minister says people can make an "informed decision".

item.title: Premier League player held over child sex allegations
item.description: The Premier League player has since been bailed and suspended by his club while inquiries continue.

item.title: Fleetwood sea death: Body of missing man found on beach
item.description: The body was found about six hours after a man was seen entering the sea in Fleetwood.

item.title: River Weaver search resumes for missing boy, 16
item.description: Police, fire and ambulance teams are scouring the River Weaver near Frodsham in Cheshire.

item.title: Record 430 migrants cross English Channel in single day
item.description: Some 50 people, including women and young children, were seen landing on a Kent beach in a dinghy.

item.title: Covid: Royal Blackburn Hospital facing huge pressures
item.description: Royal Blackburn Hospital staff say they are feeling the pressure due to a rise in Covid cases.

item.title: Paddleboarders rescue newborn calf from Somerset river
item.description: The bull has been named Splash and is back with his mother on dry land.

item.title: Man stuck in M4 jam plays football on carriageway
item.description: There was a three-hour tailback on the M4 in Wiltshire after a lorry caught fire.

item.title: Daniel Hay: Ex-patient calls for under-review surgeon to be struck off
item.description: Stephanie Blood says complications from a hysterectomy had long-lasting consequences.

item.title: Stockport couple stole Â£580k in solicitor timeshare scam
item.description: Caroline Preston and Sean Thompson are jailed for conning vulnerable and elderly people.

item.title: Covid: Six the Musical at Hull New Theatre cancelled
item.description: Hull New Theatre announces that its run of Six the Musical is off after a cast member got the virus.

item.title: Queen's Royal Swan Uppers take to the Thames
item.description: The annual census of the swan population on the River Thames is under way.

item.title: Covid: What easing restrictions mean to people in a Witham estate
item.description: What does the lifting of restrictions in England mean to those living in a housing estate?

item.title: Bridlington 'cautiously' welcomes lockdown lifting
item.description: People visiting and working in Bridlington give their views on the lifting of England's lockdown restrictions.

item.title: England nightclubs reopen: Cheers and celebrations as clubbers return for first night out
item.description: For some revellers in Leeds, this was the first time they'd ever been to a nightclub.

item.title: Covid rules from 19 July: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Derbyshire lorry driver builds kestrel nest boxes in spare time
item.description: Nature-loving lorry driver builds nest boxes for kestrels in his spare time.

item.title: Knife crime: Mum tells teenagers about her sonâs murder
item.description: Jean Foster has been talking to young people about the consequences of carrying a knife.

item.title: TikTok: Dog training tips from 'small-town Essex boy'
item.description: Adam's videos on looking after dogs have attracted more than a million followers during lockdown.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How are young people responding to the jab?
item.description: The Covid vaccine is now being offered to all over 18s. So what has uptake been like for young people?

item.title: Acrobatic rat climbs washing line for food
item.description: The tightrope-walking rodent was caught on camera trying to reach some bird feeders.

item.title: Manchester attack: Council backs 'Martyn's Law' rules for venues
item.description: The law would require nightclubs and other public venues to introduce stricter security measures.

item.title: Worker stabbed at Wolverhampton's New Cross Hospital
item.description: A 21-year-old man is arrested on suspicion of wounding the woman, police say.

item.title: Meet the paddleboarders cleaning up the canals
item.description: Volunteers have been using their spare time to go litter picking along Manchester's canal tow paths.

item.title: Gary Mavin: Hospital suicide patient 'feared being sent home'
item.description: Gary Mavin died after learning he could be discharged from a mental health unit, an inquest hears.

item.title: Luton fight: Arrests made as five people taken to hospital
item.description: Police remain at the scene of "violent disorder" in Luton that led to six arrests.

item.title: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Projected medal table, Team GB medallists and international stars to watch
item.description: Data company Gracenote forecasts the Tokyo 2020 medal table, Team GB medallists and the international stars to watch.

item.title: Derby County: EFL to allow Wayne Rooney's side to sign out-of-contract players
item.description: Derby County will be allowed to sign out-of-contract players for the new season but any deals will have strict salary limits.

item.title: Everton close in on Andros Townsend and Asmir Begovic deals and interested in Demarai Gray
item.description: Everton are closing in on deals for former Crystal Palace winger Andros Townsend and Bournemouth goalkeeper Asmir Begovic, and are interested in winger Demarai Gray.

item.title: Euro 2020 final: FA announces independent review into Wembley security breaches
item.description: The Football Association says it is determined to ensure the "disgraceful scenes" that marred the Euro 2020 final at Wembley are "never able to be repeated".

item.title: Lewis Hamilton racially abused online after British Grand Prix win
item.description: Lewis Hamilton is the target of racist abuse on social media after his victory in Sunday's British Grand Prix.
